RasterFunctionTemplate.Name: DeriveWindChillNonUV
RasterFunctionTemplate.Description: Derives windchill using a temperature variable and wind data that is not in the u/v format.

Function.Name: Wind Chill Function
Function.Description: This function computes wind chill on the Fahrenheit scale given wind speed and air temperature.

RasterFunctionTemplate.Help: Calculates windchill using a temperature variable and a single wind speed varaiable. User needs to identify the variable names in the python script as well as in the raster function. Raster function is set to take temperature in degrees Kelvin and convert this to Fahrenheit which is required by the calculation. Wind Speed needs to be in Metres per second. If the users data is not in the correct format (Kelvin / m\s) then edits to the Python will have to be made to do the conversion.
